Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: teemgee
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at the Berlin Intercontinenal, and by far the best. On this occasion we stayed for 6 nights. The hotel is a large conference hotel, but manages to cater very well for both leisure and conference guests at the same time. The hotel is also exceptionally child friendly, but not overly so, so you won't be confronted by hoards of screaming children. The hotel is not far from Ku'damm but avoids the noise and hustle and bustle of that area. It's also not too far to Potsdamer Platz - a pleasant 25-30 minute stroll alongside the river. The hotel overlooks the river and Tiergarten area at the back and our room was exceptionally quiet and peaceful. We had some issues during our previous stay, and after contacting the hotel directly, was personally assured they'd be fixed this time, and they were. This hotel offers amazing customer service - something that is lacking from many hotels these days, especially those belonging to the larger chains. Well done Intercontinental. We stayed in a suite with access to the club lounge. The room itself was spacious with a separate bedroom and living room (which also had a wall bed which could be used as needed). Fresh fruit and water were refreshed daily. As were the sweets and snacks provided for our 3 year old daughter. Another nice touch was a colouring book and pencils for kids, and the offer of turning any of the drawings into postcards by the guest services team. We didn't try this but what a wonderful idea to keep the kids entertained! As other reviewers have mentioned, the selection of TV channels is very good, and the hotel were able to arrange for a DVD player in the room so our daughter could watch her favourite DVD. The club lounge is fantastic - a haven of peace. The selection of food and drinks throughout the day was excellent and service by the lounge staff was attentive. There is free internet access via the business desk/ computer at the side of the lounge. It is well worth staying in a room with access to the club lounge. We have used club lounges in a number of hotels across the world and found those in the Far/ Middle East to be the best, but Intercontinental Berlin is just as good. All in all, I can thoroughly recommend this hotel - it's well run, clean,comfortable, excellent value for money and has some of the best staff in any hotel we've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Swimming pool & spa closed for renovation”
Reviews.Author: belle1112
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, good breakfast, attentive staff but beware the pool and spa are closed due to renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bongoblog
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 5 nights here over Easter and wish I was still there! I have stayed here a number of times and never really think of staying anywhere else. I asked to be in the Westwing as I like the decor and room layout better than the other. I had a suite with a view over the Zoo and Kaiser Willhelm memorial church. It comes with 3 tvs which have a great number of programmes inc 8 or more in English. There is now a free wifi connection, low speed for an hour or faster with payment,.fine for checking emails. Happily toiletries have returned to Elemis. I had room service breakfast most mornings and it was delivered on time and was very good,apart from the little dried out croissants! Also had a room service burger which was good and much better than previously. On the friday night I wanted something quick to eat and went in the Greek restaurant opposite, it was pretty bad and just a waste of money, so the time I had room service and was much happier. At all times the staff were friendly and helpful(as usual here) My one surprise was that the lit glass bookshelves had dust that I could write in, maybe housekeeping need some glasses(room917) Otherwise everything was kept spotless. I like the location next to the green of the Zoo and the Tiergarten but only a few mins from KaDeWe and if you want to go to Mitte there are taxis and busses at the door. I am looking forward to my next visit

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: KPnorthlondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice in the same week in this excellent hotel in a great location for public transport and shopping. The hotel staff were very efficient and friendly, and the service excellent. The rooms are clean and well furnished (including a kettle) although the position of the TV is rather odd and difficult to watch in comfort - but there is a very wide range of TV programmes and films on offer (49 different films!). It is a typical city centre conference hotel, so if you want something that is full of character and individual this isn't for you. The breakfast is superb, wide range of cold and hot food including pancakes and eggs cooked to order. There is a wide range of yoghurts, fruit, breads, pastries and teas and coffees. At busy times the restaurant is extended for breakfast into the conservatory which makes a very pleasant setting. The Marlene Bar food is very good, with efficient and pleasant service from staff speaking good English and volunteering English menus. The spa was closed for refurbishment but an alternative was offered at a nearby hotel.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT MAKE A LOCAL CALL”
Reviews.Author: Howdy55
Reviews.Content: Has to make a local call during recent stay. Was SHOCKED at check-out that local calls, even if a bloc away are 9.00 euros, approx 12USD (Info from desk mgr). Excessive is an understatement, that is,considering there are no posts in the room advising of this outrageous charge. On another note, seems to be a problem with hotels in Germany. Do not disturb means DO NOT DISTURB. That means, do not telephone the room and awake me to ask: I notice you have a DO NOT DISTURB SIGN, do you need anything? I would suggest, as Bleibtreu Hotel does, instead, leaving a note under the door.......

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel with great facilites.”
Reviews.Author: SMillington
Reviews.Content: We booked the intercontinental Berlin for a two night stay in a junior suite. Check in was very quick and efficient, and our room was exceptional; Very modern with a living room linked to the bedroom, which could be used to accommodate more people if needed. We booked on the friends and family rate and got a great rate, however, should we of had to pay the full rate it would have been well worth the money anyway. The pool and spa facilities are very well equipped and well worth making use of during your stay. All the staff was very professional and friendly and offered great service, which made us feel very welcome. If I visit Berlin again in the future I will be sure to book at the Intercontinental, thanks for a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Spoow
Reviews.Content: good hotel good services , very good rate/value room i mean its up 2 average

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in there heart of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Anthony757
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well presented. The greeting from the reception staff was immediate and I was welcomed at the priority desk so I didn't have to wait in line. Check in was efficient and I was directed politely to my room. The room on the 7th floor was beautifully styled in a modern decor, complete with coffee machine. This produced the best, free in-room coffee I have experienced in 18 years travelling true world! Such a great addition to the experience. The rooms were immaculate and the beds very comfortable, providing me with an excellent nights sleep. I left the hotel at 5:30 am for an early flight home and all the candles were lit in the lobby area demonstrating attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Dew's
Reviews.Content: I had a comfortable stay at the InterContinental Berlin. The room was reasonably spacious, with twin beds. + Good quality bedding and comfortable mattress. + Black-out curtain without too much gap around it. + Adequate desk for working, with fold-up section with mirror positioned to see your face. + Large fluffy towels and also bathrobes provided. + Rain and regular shower head over bath - Shower screening rather inadequate to avoid soaking the bathroom floor. - Wardrobe space was accessed through the bathroom. For a shared room, this creates a sort of dressing room, but it means suitcases have to be taken through the bathroom. - Long hanging space was only available by removing the ironing board and iron. - Bathroom has a sort of movable wall, containing TV and minibar facing into the room, and towel space facing into the bathroom. Swivelling this round made the bathroom semi open-plan with the bedroom, which seemed a bit of a pointless design feature. Meals I only had breakfasts in the hotel. The buffet had a wide choice: food was fresh and well presented. All employees provided good service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Five Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Heer84
Reviews.Content: Recently got back from a weekend break in Berlin. Being a Platinum Ambassador I was upgraded to a Delluxe Room on the 7th floor which had a good view of Berlin. The room was the biggest I have ever stayed in with really modern furnishing and an equally big bathroom. Only slight issue was that most of the places we wanted to visit were not a walking distance away do we used taxis a lot - although the public transport from the hotel is really good. Paid a supplement for Club Lounge access which was money well spent. As well as a great breakfast, they also have a buffets lunch and dinner with warm canapés in the evening. I was particularly impressed with the choice of spirits and champagne in the Club Lounge open bar which is open from 6-10pm. They also have an iPad which can be used for guests in the club lounge which I thought is a really nice touch. After seeing the sights and sounds of Berlin I returned to my room to find my complimentary bottle of water and fruit bowl with a wide selection of fruited, along with a welcome letter and box of choiclates. When reading the letter I was pleasantly surprised to find that the in room mini bar was complimentary (I think this comes part of the Lounge Access - which made it all the more worth the supplement). Kevin at the concierge desk gave excellent local knowledge. Every time I rang down from the room, the person who answerd the phone always greated me with my last name, and checkout was effortless. Will be very difficult to find another hotel as good as this one in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Business trip”
Reviews.Author: cheesycheese
Reviews.Content: I am always aboard for business and this if the first time to stay in this hotel. I normally use Stienbureg, I am speachless at this hotel as it was so bad. Noisy disco parties, and imagine where, the LOBBY bar every night! There was around 2,000 prosatutues every night that interrupter you everywhere you go in the hotel after 8pm. This was will really destroy the reputation that InterConti have. Room service was very slow. I did have a problem with my heart and they respond with an ambulancemen in 3 minutes, so I do have to say thank you for them for4 this, and also big thanks to the first aider. Food not bad and the room was nicely cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “Great Modern Hotel - Bad Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: ButNekkid
Reviews.Content: I'll start from saying, that it is the best Intercontinental I ever stayed in. Hotel is new, modern, close everywhere (as close as it can be in a big city like Berlin). receptionists were great, especially those in Club Lounge (excellent value for money btw). I liked the fact, that there were plenty of English Language channels, usually hotels are just limiting their TV offer with CNN and BBC. The only minus - housekeeping is not very well trained. Every day they were forgetting something, like change the sheets, bring new toiletries, fill up mini-bar etc., however it was fixed in a heartbeat after I called to reception. And guys, your wake-up call system needs fixing, it's mixing up the times and rooms (at least it was so in my case). But there is nothing perfect, at least you close to perfection:)

Reviews.Title: “A good conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveller400
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located next to the zoo and the main shopping street. However, if you have visited Berlin before worth exploring closer to the "wall" area. There are some trendy bars and restaurants while next to the hotel eating out is limited.

Reviews.Title: “First time in interconti hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Vincent_D_BE
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel , Nice location , great breakfast . Received a good upgrade and large room. Busy due to a big event in the hotel, but totally no problem for this professional hotel. Thanks V

Reviews.Title: “OK but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: VeitchB
Reviews.Content: There is an ok hotel and if you are on a business trip to Berlin it is absolutely fine. It is however rather lacking in personality and the location is not great but ok. If you are in Berlin for more than one night or on holiday then there are better hotels in Berlin to have as a base. Before booking check that that the hotel is not hosting a big conference (like SuperReturn) otherwise you might the hotel bar and lobby area swarming with men in grey suits. Rooms (or at least my room) was ok although far too warm and the TV was in a cupboard with a glass screen in front of it such that you couldn't watch TV from the bed! That and the fact that the minibar and coffee were not replenished were the only things which detracted from and otherwise functional room.

Reviews.Title: “Treated very well we love to visit again and again”
Reviews.Author: Michael H
Reviews.Content: The staff especially Melanie in the Club Lounge (the staff are extremely well trained and professional) are superb! We love the east wing, it dazzles in superior modern qualities, the bathrooms are excellent with the swing-around-TV cube so you can relax in the bathtub watch a film or enjoy a glass of wine. Front office staff are also just perfect - every need and desire is their command. I have been a priority club platinum member since 2006 I think and I just love Intercontinental Hotels - well done everyone keep up the good work at Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “fulfills all the expectations”
Reviews.Author: PushingTheSenses
Reviews.Content: the intercontinental berlin is conveniently located in the city, next to the zoo. it duly offers anything that you would expect from a 5-star hotel, both in terms of service and amenities. some highlights: - the quality of room service food was better than in most other hotels. - service at breakfast was prompt and friendly, although the hotel was full because of the congress we attended. another positive: the buffet included some good asian options. - service is meticulous and staff throughout the hotel are extremely helpful and knowledgable, whether at reception, bar or restaurant - or whether you just bump into someone... we decided to make use of the swimming pool and realized we would have to walk to the other side of the building from our room. a staff member kindly directed us to the cleverly laid out open corridor above the lobby to the swimming pool, where you can walk in your bathrobe without being seen from the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Stay In A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: craigvassie
Reviews.Content: Great hotel close to Zoo. Not the most convenient location - 10 minute walk to Zoo DB / U-bahn (metro) station, or to Wittenbergplatz U-bahn, but the 200 bus stops right outside and the lovely rooms more than make up for the slight inconvenience...... We were given a spacious spotlessly clean and well-maintained deluxe room on an upper floor with views over the Tiergarten. Very comfortable bed. Great bathroom. Best hotel breakfast we've had for ages - top of the IHG brand for Europe and well worth the €30. Great friendly staff who ALL smile and say "hello" - true ambassadors! Weekend rates at this hotel are very competitive, and you get good value for your money. Be sure to try it soon!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel located in the heart of Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: OnePassPlatinum
Reviews.Content: Good business traveller hotel with spacious rooms and relatively friendly staff. The heat controls, however, are not adjustable and they keep the 7th floor at a toasty 30 degrees C. I asked them to address this but in my 6 days it was not addressed.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not out of this world”
Reviews.Author: crowdedcat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights here as a base to see Berlin. We booked a Deluxe Room after reviewing the various rooms on the English web site of the hotel. I was misled into thinking a Deluxe Room was a Club Room - don't be fooled! On discovering that breakfast wasn't included, I asked the receptionist what the difference was between a standard and a deluxe room. All she could tell me was that there was a bit more space, and a coffee maker. I believe the standard room has a coffee make actually, so apparently all you get is a sofa. My advice would be to stick with the standard room. The hotel itself is pleasantly opulent with a delightful and extensive bar area. The spa was closed for our stay, and we were told we could have complimentary use of the one at the nearby Hotel Pullman. But at minus 8, we weren't inclined to trip across the road in not very much! We didn't feel like spending 30 Euros each on breakfast, so we took the bus to Ku'damm and ate there. Many cafes sell a good German breakfast (egg, rolls, hams, salamis, cheese, jam, coffee etc) for 8.50 Euros. Likewise the prices at the bar were a bit eye-watering: 10.50 for an Irish Coffee and 8.50 for a pot of camomile tea. However, no-one books a 5 star hotel and expects cheap prices, and the real problem with this hotel as that a bus or taxi is needed for every trip - especially in the very cold winter weather. Ku'damm is 15 mins away, but it is a trudge, not a delightful walk. Potsdamer Platz is 10 mins on the bus in the other direction. Having said that, the bus does go every 10 minutes, so it's not exactly a hardship, but it is worth saying that this hotel is too expensive for someone not on business to be a captive in, and therefore make sure you buy a tourist ticket for the BVG (we bought the 72 hour Welcome Card). The service was good and when we needed the feather bedding and pillows changed for hypoallergenic ones, it happened quickly and without fuss. We were told in good time that our water would be turned off for an hour in the early morning. The room itself was not overly large, despite its alleged 'deluxe' nature. There was a nespresso machine, which was a nice touch, but only three capsules to put in it. The bed was queen size, when I think king would have been more appropriate. The flat screen TV was against the wall, and couldn't be fully pointed at the bed. And it was *warm*. The temperature control was permanently on 24 degrees. It was all a bit ... underwhelming. Next time I'm in Berlin, I will stay at the swissotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful experience at InterConti Berlin”
Reviews.Author: DPlantagenet
Reviews.Content: I have considered myself a regular of this hotel, though unfortunately I had not been able to visit it even once in the past 4 years. Every time I come to this hotel I am reminded of why it is that I keep coming back. Staff is nice, friendly, effective, professional and informed. Any question you have, they will answer. Any request, they will accommodate and find a way to satisfy it. I was taking my Mother to Berlin for the first time (short stay, unfortunately) and wanted to awe her... it worked. We arrived a bit early used the Ambassador check-in, left the bags and rushed out. Didn't even notice the room. When we came back to our upgraded 2-room senior suite my Mother was delighted to see the abundance of amenities, including a TV in the bathroom, as well as a static-bike. I won't even talk about the quality of the Elemis bathroom amenities, the plushy and comfortable bedding, the spaciousness of the room, the perfection of the thermostat-controlled temperature, the amazing heated bathroom tiles (how can it be the only InterConti that I have been to that has this amenity? It should be compulsory; it's great!)... and we couldn't even complain about the corner views of Tiergarten from our high-floor (for Berlin standards). Only thing I regretted not being able to show my Mother was the ingenious bathroom system that they have in normal rooms... love the engineering design. I asked for a rollaway bed, which was installed in the living-room, and it was promptly brought up and swiftly set. Probably one of the most comfortable rollaway beds I have ever tried. Treated my Mother to the astounding breakfast buffet. One of the best and most extensive ones in Europe and the US; worth every penny (though cannot be compared to the ones in the Middle East or Asia). I expect to be back again this Summer for longer. I've missed the treat of staying at one of the places where I get treated the best.

Reviews.Title: “From IC and back to IC”
Reviews.Author: Traveloholicman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this IC hotel many times during last 8 years. The change chain belonging during 2011 and was dropped out from Intercontinental brand and then back again. Planning next visit in feb 2011 and I really hope is upwards normal IC standard. Always stays in Club floor and the little sad thing is that the service and quality of food has on the downside for last years but the room prices on the upside. Still, if you are stressed and really like to have the facilities of a big international hotel but wants to have a little privacy Club floor is good and more private. High security as well. If you want a really good dinner, visit Hugo´s at the west? wing , highest floor. Not cheap but higly recommended. I will give this one more try and will see if they have improved the total overall impression. Looking back five years the staff was more dedicated and had more proudness than during my last visit late 2011. I have stayed at about ten different similar class hotels in Berlin and this was the best before if you want discretion and a huge bathroom with a lovely rain shower and highclass soap and creams. ( Molton Brown was the best, changed for another firm),

Reviews.Title: “Delightful surprise”
Reviews.Author: Linda H
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Berlin. We purchased a "package deal" through the German rail system for a three night stay in Berlin. We were originally booked into a hotel near the Berlin airport but chose to upgrade to the Intercontinental, Berlin. What a great decision! The hotel was located near many of the sights we wanted to see (the Brandenburg Gate, Holocaust Memorial, Checkpoint Charley and the Berlin Wall). There was a great Christmas Market within walking distance as was the Berlin Zoological Gardens. Our room was well appointed and very comfortable. The concierge was very helpful, suggesting some wonderful places to eat within walking distance. We were only a few blocks from a nice bakery so we chose to eat there and have a nice walk each morning. We did eat in the hotel one evening for dinner. Our meal was delicious and the service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Top!”
Reviews.Author: Eliot22
Reviews.Content: There is nothing you can say about this hotel that is bad. For business purposes, which I use it for, there aren't many hotels in the world better than this one. Having said that, I stay at Club level so I don't know what types of rooms there are below. The breakfast buffet is absolutely out of this world, the staff are friendly and helpful and the hotel amenities - both in and outside the room - are superb. If there is any downside to this hotel it might be the location. Then again, for business you might not be interested and, to be honest, I hardly have time to look around. Berlin might actually be on the doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jeff K
Reviews.Content: We travel internationally at least 5 times every year and this hotel must rank as the very best of the best. Everything about this hotel reached standards of excellence coupled with a friendliness from the staff that made you feel at home and special guest at the same time. We will most certainly endeavour to come back as frequently as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Always Good”
Reviews.Author: ninjalad
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here quite a few times over the last 6 years and always been happy. Yes sometimes there have been room attendants who ignore the do not disturb sign,which can be very annoying, for the rest the staff have always been helpful and friendly. I always used to take a room in the East wing with the club rooms on the 8th floor being the nicest, since the refurbishment I now like the West wing better,see the pics. Breakfast in the LA cafe is truly a huge buffet offering evering possible, the bad point is it can get very busy and noisy. As I eat little in the morning I tend to have room service which always arrives on time and fresh. The club floor breakfast is also very good and fairly peaceful, with the added benefit of a self service coffee bar as I need a few cappucinos to get me going. The room rates here are mostly pretty good and the prices for food&drink are normal for a 5* hotel. I do agree that these days luxury hotels should include wifi. If you are thinking of staying here I can recommend it, I will be back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: SolTabet
Reviews.Content: I first visited this hotel in 2004 and i slept 8 times there so far. Great rooms,spa,swiming pool,cigar lounge, marlyn cafe,..... It is near the zoo, down town,kadewe,europacenter,... Everything is excellent

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with excellent club lounge”
Reviews.Author: Anita1439404
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the weekend before Christmas to visit the many Christmas markets in Berlin. We were upgraded to a junior suite which was very spacious and comfortable; the walk-in shower in the bathroom was one of the largest we have seen in a hotel. Food and drink in the club lounge was excellent, from an extended continental breakfast through to dinner with plenty of food choice, along with wines, spirits and soft drinks. Apart from the Christmas markets, the highlight of our trip was visiting the Reichstag - it is free, but has to be booked a couple of weeks before for security clearance. The weekend was a lovely early present to get us in the mood for Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “CHRISTMAS IN GERMANY”
Reviews.Author: lba0117
Reviews.Content: When in Berlin, If you are looking for a Five Star plus hotel with reasonable prices then IC BERLIN is it! great location to west and east Berlin. Accross the hotel bus number 200 will take you to anywhere you want to go in minutes and goes through all the important monuments. If you can stay on the club level do so, it is amazing and will save you money on food through out the day and late into the night. The concierge is the best I have come across anywhere in the world. Behind the hotel is the main park, great for morning stroll, you are minutes from all the important and beautiful monuments.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and amazing breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: nokad10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is superbly designed, with big rooms and lots of thought to make the business traveler comfortable in the room. The pool area is beautiful and very clean. The most amazing breakfast spread that I have ever seen in a hotel anywhere with a mind boggling variety of food to cater to all nationalities (Asian corner) and tastes (organic corner). Wonderful selection of teas and coffees.

Reviews.Title: “good place with convenient location”
Reviews.Author: chepekun
Reviews.Content: berlin is an exciting city and this hotel makes a very good base to explore it. the rooms are good and clean, but the views are rather poor. the best for us was certainly the breakfast buffet with a very wide range of delicious things. my wife was especially pleased by the japanese selection of breakfast, because she comes from there.

Reviews.Title: “one wifi system short of perfection”
Reviews.Author: DCFrequentFlier
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the early evening. A doorman immediately took contrrol of our bags. We walked into a big open wood and marble lobby. Fast friendly check-in to deluxe rooms, one on the 6th floor and one on the 4th floor. As we walked to our rooms, the porter pointed out the location of the pool, spa, bar and restaurants. Quick elevator ride to our floor. Contemporary well maintained corridors. The room door opened into a small foyer with a nifty little spot to hangncoats, a floor to ceiling mirror on one side (thank you) and a modern spacious bathroom on the other. As you walked into the bath, there was a nice sized closet/wardrobe and a leather covered spot to put suitcases. The bath had a large tub, glass enclosed toilet with bidet and a glass enclosed shower. There is also a lighted make up mirror and a real full size full power blow dryer (thank you again). You walk thru the foyer inti a sitting area with sofa, tables and a desk. There is a console housing a mini bar to separate the sitting area from the bed. On top of the console there is a coffee/tea maker. The rooms has two huge windows that open. We faced the zoo! The room is also filled with lots of lights, No dark boutique coolness here, you can actually see your hand in front of your face! The room was large, spotlessly cleaned, and modern. Loved it! It's only drawback...no wifi. A hotel such as this needs wifi. The hotel is located in a nice area..busy during the day but quiet (aka dead) at night. It took us about 25 to 30 minute to walk through the tiergarten to Mitte, Mitte is where everything seems to be going on from a tourist point of view. It's very easy to catch cabs, buses and trams... We ate breakfast at the hotel one morning. Huge buffet but pricey at 30 euros if you want hot food. The continental is 20 euros. Our service was not good. We had to actually go to the coffee bar ourselves to get our lattes because our waiter could not be bothered. The hotel has a nice open bar with a huge list of cocktail options. We had a round and thought they were great. Overall very happy with the IC and would/will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Great rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: CaptainCAL
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times, it's always a pleasure! Very friendly and accommodating staff. Very comfortable rooms. Great location. Check out the Zoo right next door!

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChrisLondon59
Reviews.Content: Location The hotel is located in close proximity to Kurfuerstendamm, the Zoo Aquarium and Garden. Currently there is a christmas market close by (memorial church). It is fairly easy to get into the city centre by S-Bahn. Transportation The closest subway stations are ‘Zoologischer Garten’ and ‘Kurfuerstendamm’, both are a approximately 5-10 minute walk and trains run very frequently. Room The room was a very nice boutique room and always clean. The view was not great but the room makes up for it. Only downside was the small TV, although it has its purpose (you can watch TV from the bath as well as from the bed). Staff Staff has always been very professional and helpful. Gym/Spa The gym and spa is to a surprisingly very high standard for a business hotel as the InterContinental. I have been very pleasantly surprise. The pool is also very nice, though the gym is rather small’ish (standard hotel size). Food The breakfast buffet has a big variety and a lot of organic products which is great. Very tasty as well as healthy. Staff is switch on and attentive during breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but crappy internet service”
Reviews.Author: purpleladyLeuven
Reviews.Content: Only negative was that Internet access in the room was charged to the bill and the connection was bad and interrupted. Not acceptable for a business hotel where wifi should be complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “Only Place I Stay In Berlin”
Reviews.Author: P S
Reviews.Content: I travel to Berlin for work, and this is the only hotel I stay in. The hearty German breakfast really helps cure the jet lag. If you're really up for a treat, try the hot chocolate -- steamed milk with bit of milk, dark, and white chocolate to mix in. My only complaint is the weird split comforter, but I've been told this is a German thing.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gajoma
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights at the end of November, and we couldnt have chosen a better hotel. Check in was very efficient, and we were upgraded to a superior room, which was fantastic. Very spacious, spotlessly clean and with a coffee machine and a good supply of tea and coffee. The bathroom was absolutely beautiful with a fantastic walk in shower, a good supply of large towels and bathrobe and slippers. Also lovely toiletries. The staff were extremely pleasant and very helpful when asked for directions or suggestions for restaurants. The hotel itself is in a very good area for getting around berlin and seeing all the sights. The bus stops right outside the door and there is also a taxi rank outside. All in all we had a lovely time in Berlin and would hope to return, and we will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Amanda S
Reviews.Content: Intercontinental Berlin is fantastic. It is in a great part of town, the staff is attentive and knowledgeable and the rooms are lovely. In Europe, you often find small rooms, old furniture and sub-par linens. At the Intercontinental, I had a large room, incredible bed and linens, a beautiful robe and slippers, extra large towels, a rain shower, great toiletries, a safe, a scale and heated bathroom floors. This hotel is everything a hotel should be and I will be staying there next time I am in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Bad UX”
Reviews.Author: dsmiz
Reviews.Content: I work in software where User Experience (UX) is king. If your product is hard to use, no one will use it. However, the Intercontinental does not have the same appreciation for the user, or in this case, hotel guest. I stayed at the hotel for a large technology conference. For the first day and half the ethernet in all the rooms was down. Well that's fine you may say, I didn't want to spend 20 Euros on ethernet anyways, I'll just connect to the Wifi. Wrong. There's no Wifi in the rooms. What kind of a hotel, one that obviously caters to a business crowd, doesn't have wifi in the rooms? As far as the rooms go, they are quite nice. The bathroom is large and the closet has a ton of space. My one gripe here is the shower. It is extremely funky and modern, which is nice. However, I challenge you to try and take a shower without getting water all over the floor. If you succeed you are a much more cautious and conscientious bather then this reviewer. Finally the breakfast is fantastic. If this review was for the breakfast alone, it would get 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LatinaViva
Reviews.Content: We booked the Interconti via binoli for a very good price. The hotel itself is great. The rooms spacious and good equipped. Breakfast was excellent! I would be happy to have it every day..... 2 Negative points: - the cocktails at the bar in the SPA-area where not handmade and for this fact too expensive. - wlan is not for free

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel with very nice service”
Reviews.Author: OtherJFK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the InterContinental over the two days when they host their biggest event of the year, so the lobby was closed off and the staff was mostly focused on the big gala event one night. (The music was very loud and lasted until sometime after 2 am.) Even with a big event going on, the staff was attentive and helpful. We had spent the four previous nights at the Courtyard (on business) and found the InterCon much more expensive for smaller rooms that weren't all that clean. We had access to the club lounge so that was a nice place to hang out and nibble on the food that was out all day. It was also a place to get free wifi!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in an excellent location, even after the fall of the wall.”
Reviews.Author: Arkenbout
Reviews.Content: Great location, next to the zoo and near to the Kurfurstendam. Nice and spacious, modern, rooms with good and very spacious bathrooms. One of the first modern hotels built in West Berlin after WW2. Great hamburgers in the bar!

Reviews.Title: “1 night too short!”
Reviews.Author: EP1024
Reviews.Content: Services were great, the rooms very clean. The only negative I have to say is that the conference took over the hotel, we arrived at 9 pm and because of the conference the restaurants were shut so we had to walk to nearby restaurant! Other than that it was great!

Reviews.Title: “A does-nothing-wrong large-but-friendly business hotel”
Reviews.Author: ianjindal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night in November and attended a conference there too. Massive hotel lobby with loads of seating, clean modern design with a nice 'quality' feel. The lobby is bustling rather than crowded, and there are LOADS of staff around, all smiling, helping and queue-busting as if there's no tomorrow. Charming and very efficient desk staff added to the overall feeling of welcome and efficiency. Rooms were not massive, but certainly ample, with the facilities clean and modern. It's no 'boutique luxury' hotel, but one's certainly not slumming it! Beds - comfy. Aircon - good but a bit noisy. Food was good in the restaurant (the conference was catered) and the catering staff looked like they a) cooked and b) enjoyed it - so often the waiters look like bussed-in out-of-work actors practicing the "Grudging" method approach - this was a really nice change. Further plusses are: - free wifi in the hotel lobby (reliable, but not massively fast) - the pool/spa - really nice but also - wonderfully - open from 0600 through 2300. Plenty of time around work for a swim, even though the pool's not very big for lengths. Downsides: - no wifi in the rooms. There's free wired connections (remember ethernet?) but it cost me €30 to get an adapter for the Air. Knowing this would have helped - mineral water at minibar prices. Location was "OK". I don't know Berlin that well but I felt a bit 'off to the left' at the bottom of the Tiergarten. However, it was a leisurely stroll to the Brandenburg Gate through the gardens (c 25 mins, 15 if I'd be more purposeful). For a business hotel this is a benchmark for effortless delivery. For a romantic weekend it'd have to be a deal on a nice room with plenty of spa use to be considered.

Reviews.Title: “For Business purposes it was outstanding”
Reviews.Author: ILTLondon
Reviews.Content: Firstly its a massive hotel. The lobby, bar area etc is huge. If I was there for pleasure it would have been too impersonal but for business it was just fine. The decor of both the rooms and common areas is fantastic.Uber modern, clean & tidy. Attention to detail in the rooms is outstanding, I literally cannot fault it. There are hotels with much better reputations that could do with taking a leaf out of this hotels book-it really is that good. Wifi is free in the lobby, but not in the rooms-this is a bit of a bummer-and they should review this policy asap, esp. as it's a business type hotel. Bathroom, shower, bath etc, all 1st class. The bed was very comfortable, TV reception was great. Only ate breakfast there and it was fantastic. The only minor negative would be an under staffed bar, which is a shame because the management knows when big conferences are booked!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: KoshKoshka
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during a conference held there for a few nights. The rooms are really nice, beds are extremely comfy and there is also a shower from the ceiling in addition to the usual shower. There is a swimming pool there with jakuzzi as well which guests can use for free. If it is not 'the season', you can still get the swimming costume in KaDeWe (which is about 15 mins away) or in the hotel itself, however, the choice isnt so good.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel, but definitely not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: teemgee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a leisure break for 7 nights with our 3 year old daughter. Plus points Location is good – next door to Zoo, near Ku’damm, Europa Center, and convenient for local buses and local trains (not so convenient if you want to travel further afield as the Hauptbahnhof is quite a distance away). Breakfast buffet offers a good selection of hot and cold food, including a Japanese selection, organic choices and a children’s buffet at weekends. However the buffet does get busy and some mornings we had to wait for a seat. Bedrooms are reasonably sized with an excellent choice of TV Channels Minus points We were offered the option of paying to upgrade to Ambassador status when we checked in, which offered a better, larger room with separate seating area, with mineral water and fresh fruit always available, plus a 4pm checkout. The room we were assigned was standard sized (had 2 seats but not a separate area) and overlooked the main road (even though we had asked for a quiet room on our reservation). The fresh fruit arrived on day 1 and we got no more. Although we had a late checkout on the day we were leaving, our daughter’s bed was removed soon after breakfast and we were pestered by housekeeping wanting to find out when we were checking out. When we mentioned these issues on checking out, we were told that we should have complained…. I think the hotel should have got things right to start with! Housekeeping – I can only describe this as sloppy. Bedlinen was not changed frequently (our daughter’s bedding wasn’t changed in 7 days). Housekeeping had a tendency to leave the dirty glasses without cleaning them and didn’t always replenish the complimentary tea/ coffee. Turndown service was minimal (remove blanket from bed and that was it!) Bathroom layout – the room we were in had a shower over the bath with a very small screen so it was difficult to shower without soaking the bathroom floor. The bathroom area had the bathroom itself, a separate toilet and the wardrobe, luggage area and safe. This was very odd and got to be a bit inconvenient when you wanted to go to the wardrobe and someone else was in the bathroom. Overall a pretty disappointing stay, the hotel seems to cater for the large conferences rather than leisure visitors, and there are much better hotels to stay in in Berlin, particularly in Gendarmenmarkt.

Reviews.Title: “Service is Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: SEE1981
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 5 night stay at this lovely hotel.. Berlin is a huge city but we had no trouble getting around from this location, near the Zoo. The hotel is well maintained and like every good American, I must comment on the excellent bathroom. My overall impression is that the staff is gracious and very helpful and this was much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel,Super location”
Reviews.Author: GPeto
Reviews.Content: There is not much more you can want from a hotel then this. Its good. Very good. On check-in i was offered the option of upgrading to a deluxe room for 26 EUR (i was told it has a separate shower....which is a big thing for me as I hate taking showers in the bath tub). The price of the upgrade was WORTH IT!!!!!. Loved the room. The pool is also nice however its strange that if u want to use the saune thats an extra 15EUR. Location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, breakfast and room”
Reviews.Author: newbornbliss
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four night as i was attending a conference in the hotel. My room was very modern but also welcoming. The design was very funky and the bathroom was spacious and had a great waterfall shower as well as a separate bath. There was a coffee machine and large safe (which was hidden in the bedside table and took a while to locate!) The hotel service was excellent from front desk to the restaurants to general staff walking around. The breakfast had a really excellent selection including fantastic pastries and some unusual fruit juices. The restaurant had a really varied menu to suit all tastes an the hotel Marlene bar was well stocked. I can't say much about the location as unfortunately i was stuck in the hotel for the duration of my stay!

Reviews.Title: “My Second Favourite Intercontinental!”
Reviews.Author: ebookpunkie
Reviews.Content: Jointly with Istanbul... But it's a great hotel - the staff are friendy, helpful and seem to really look out for the customers. Hotel is centrally located and next to the Zoo. Pool faclities are good and its a real pleasure to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & great stay”
Reviews.Author: S C
Reviews.Content: Great room. Pull out sofa for children was very comfortable. The staff especially the concierges and the staff in the bar area were great. After a long day of sightseeing the lounge was a comfortable spot to have a drink and a pizza snack for the kids. Staff even hunted down a creme brulee for me even though it is not on the bar menu! I can't wait to return and I definitely will stay here. The breakfast was yummy. We were here for a conference but the kids and I tagged along.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for first visit to Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Su8108
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights at this hotel in my first visit to this lovely city for a convention. Would recommend this for its location and accessibility to shopping and nice parks.Friendly concierge. Room is spacious but TV is small and poorly located. TV programmes are also limited.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fitchy_gent
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at the InterContinental, during a convention. Hotel is close to main shopping streets, Berlin Zoo, ... Likes - comfortable bed - room well equipped (minibar, safe, ...) - great breakfast - fantastic pool (6am-11pm) Dislikes - no wireless internet available in the rooms. Unbelievable ;-) - free wi-fi limited to hotel lobby

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Moodo
Reviews.Content: My first stay at an Intercontinental - fantastic! Our initial hotel overbooked so they transfered us to this hotel. It was a fantastic stroke of luck. We were made to feel very welcome by the friendly staff-service could not have been better. The rooms were immaculate and very well equipped-pillows were extremely comfortable! Bathroom was spotless and shower system was great. Breakfast was incredible! Our stay in Berlin was great and staying here was the icing on the cake!

Reviews.Title: “World Class Comfort”
Reviews.Author: pascalli2
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at an Intercontinental hotel, and I was quite impressed. I have stayed at a lot of hotels, and this is in running for the top slot in my book. The only negative aspect I can report is that we were placed in a smoking room. I am not letting this affect my rating, though, since we did not request a non-smoking room when booking, arrived after 9pm, and there was a conference with 2000 guests going on so there were no rooms to switch us to. We were in a deluxe room, and it was pristine - I could not tell that it was a smoking room (although it was evident in the hallway that we were in the smoker's section). The shower was great, the bed was comfortable enough, and the layout and furnishings made the space feel large and accommodating. The icing on the cake was the wonderful breakfast. If it is not too much more than the rate you are looking at, consider getting one with breakfast included. They had a huge variety, and some very tasty items, including organic, biodynamic cheese, bread and salami. They had a wonderful coffee and tea station, pastries, omelets, even japanese soup. I would definitely recommend the Intercontinental Berlin, if your budget allows it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Judith N
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a long weekend in Berlin, in which we have stayed at the Intercontinental and our stay in the Intercontinental was one of the things which made our vacation wonderful. The location is great - in the center, but yet in a quiet street and not to crowded. Just in front of the hotel there is a bus station (line 200 which runs through many highlights in Berlin) and 5-7 minutes walks from U-bahn station. The service was very welcoming and attentive - we did not have any trouble in checking in early due to our flight. the rooms were big, clean and comfortable - we were upgraded to a Deluxe room which had a big, nice bathroom with separate shower, bath-tub and toilet. However, one downside of the room is the TV which was small and we could not watch it from our bed due to its strange location...also the channels variety waspoor. One of highlights was definitely the buffet breakfast which was excellent - a variety of choices, fresh and tasty - it was a delight and we very much enjoyed it - a true pleasure! In short the hotel is very much recommended and will surely turn your stay in Berlin to an enjoyable and well remembered stay!

Reviews.Title: “Just a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: thewind01
Reviews.Content: I have stayed about ten times at the InterContinental Berlin and I have to say that I really have become a fan. It is a huge hotel very well situated. A 5 minutes walk from "Ku'damm", Tiergarten and Gedächtniskirche. 7 minutes to Bahnhof Zoo, where you can catch the bus X9 to Tegel airport or many other trains to reach every spot in Berlin. A taxi from or to Tegel airport never cost me more than 20€ and when I arrived in Schönefeld I took the S-Bahn train to Bahnhof Zoo. Just in front of the hotel there's the bus 200 which will take you within 10 minutes to other places of downtown Berlin like Unter den Linden, Potzdamer Platz and Friedrichstrasse. Checkin and checkout are always very professional, without any hassle and besides the capacity of the hotel there's rarely queuing...Whenever you pay for Ambassador membership for InterContinental Hotels they always (at least in my case) upgrade you to the next higher category. And to get a deluxe room with them is just great. It's very spacious, recently renovated and very modern. King Size Bed, Seating area, Flat screen TV, great lighting options, espresso coffee/tea maker, I-pod docking station, huge bath room with separated shower cabin and bath tub. Also discover their spa area, which is just beautiful with pool and sauna. Internet is 20€ for 24 h in the room and works very well (cable)...they also have deals if you stay a week. One hour of free wireless connection is offered to each guest in the lobby which is a good thing when you are not on a business trip and just want to check your mail. Furthermore I just can recommend Marlene Bar for drinks. At anytime of the day it is nice to sit in this huge bar and just watch the people. On weekends they have a great brunch in their L.A. Café for 30€ with loads of food and sparkling wine (yep, no champagne if I remember right). Another plus is their room service which I used during every stay. They just manage to deliver delicious food, which is not so often the case with room service. Once I had dinner at Hugo's, which is their luxury restaurant on the 14th floor, and it's a class of its own, which I can highly recommend if you have something to celebrate or just love gorgeous food. Well, that’s about all I can say about the IC Berlin. Did I ever have a problem there? Certainly, but they were minor ones and resolved immediately, polite and professional. I will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best 4* Luxe Hotels in Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: LeTerrible
Reviews.Content: I love this Intercontinental and as I am platinum and a member of the Ambassador's club..you could say I know my way around an 'Intercontinental Hotel'. The hotel is situated in a wonderful area of what was West Berlin and you can walk to many sites or grab a U-Bahn (Berlin..like New York..is not a city that you can see just by walking...too disperesed). This hotel has spruced up since my last visit and result is upgraded amenities in the rooms and a bit more of the 21stC in the lobby..without losing the quirky and wonderful architectural uniqueness of its past. The staff is top notch from the moment you are welcomes to the hotel until the moment you check out. Breakfast, room service, special needs...effortless and stress-free as a Hotel of this caliber should be. We were upgraded to a suite the second night but honestly, this is the first Intercontinetal I've stayed in for a while where the standards were a very nice size. This is one of the reasons I like this hotel. Everyone is treated with importance and given what should be 'the Intercontinetal experience'. Bathrooms were large and modern with amenities from L'Occitane. The bed was one of the most comfortable I've experienced in Europe since staying at the 'Le Grand' in Paris a few months ago (and I've back to France several times between that trip and this one to Berlin). The rooms are modern but with an emphasis on bridging the gap between certain 'classic high-end' furinishings like the tons of closets and the lovely walnut dresser that I wanted to take home. I received free wi-fi in my room and a bottle of water each day being in 'Priority Club' The room (standard and the Suite) were just a 5* oasis of luxe and calm after a busy day. Of course the wonderful lobby bar that serves some wonderful unknown French champagnes by the glass and the restaurant for breakfast are also in the luxe category. Wonderful breakfast that was included in our price and it an abudance of choices ..truly..I skipped lunch after I ate a bit too much the first morning. (German sausages are the best in the world and you'll have your choice here at breakfast). We never had time to dine at the hotel as we were visiting friends and also part of a convention. Lastly...Hotel prices in Berlin in the 5*/4*+luxe category are pretty stiff! I find that this hotel gives you more for the Euro and though it is not budget nor moderate in price, it is lower than most of the other hotels in its category that don't rate with this grande Dame not far from Mitte, in West Berlin. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional Intercontinental with service still working”
Reviews.Author: Maitland55
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in August 2011 when the property had changed back to Intercontinental Due to a financial disagreement it had left the IHG and even the name had been taken off the roof.. and was not back there. The room was very nice, and the wide selection of TV channels made a difference. I have used on several occations the Intercontinental in Montreal, and the service attitude and availability of the staff was much better here, in comparison to Montreal. I must saythough that I do speak German, while I do not speak French (which may impair my treatment in Montreal). The location is good for those with business and leasure in the "old West Berlin". There is one bus going past connecting with the New East. Underground and city railroad quite a walk, and a bit desolate at night.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent stay”
Reviews.Author: JeppisPibe
Reviews.Content: Not lots of words are needed to describe this hotel – everything was very nice! The experience from the staff service to restaurants and the location was more that what I expected. The room was spacious and very comfortable. After the workday I really enjoyed the Spa. There is a large pool and good variety of saunas and other facilities. Especially I enjoyed the resting area with waterbeds!!! GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “I really like this place but my room was dated looking”
Reviews.Author: liberal5
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here over 4 times times and appreciate that there are still a few smoking rooms here. I probably get an older looking room even though I am a Platinum Mamber of IHG because I always request smoking. Smokers are having a harder and harder time finding a place, not that I blame the hotels. I myself do not like a smoking room that is not aired out before I get there. That said the mattresses here are the best and the bathrooms are really the best I have ever encountered especially if you have a friend with you. The tub is quite roomy and separate from the shower. Toilet even is seperated by a door so its all quite nice. THe location of this place is a favorite for me. You can walk to Kurfurstendam, The Zoo, a major train station (all in about 15 minutes). Breakfasts here are better than the average 4-5 star hotel and compare favorably with any breakfast in Berlin. If smokers could get a room with a balcony or a remodelled room I would always stay here when visiting Berlin. Note when I say the smoking rooms are dated they are by no means ugly or worn out. THe style of the furniture is just a bit older and the TVs are not modern flat screens. They are still nicely appointed rooms with good blackout drapes and the same great bathrooms. The service at the desk is also always efficient and friendly and the rooms are clean. The piano bar is busy if there is a convention but then those are people looking to talk to other conventioneers, its not a popular hangout for locals or to strike up a conversation with anybody outside your party. So unless there is a convention(which is frequent by the way) the place is rather quiet. One of my only gripes is that Internet access from the room is too expensive. I mean its ridiculous that I get free internet from dozens of coffee shops where I spend 5$ but I can easily spend 1500$ for 10-12 days at a Hotel and then be charged an extra 20$/day for the internet in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Nusiax
Reviews.Content: Just came from a long weekend in Berlin, We stayed at the IC Berlin. Great hotel, the service was outstanding. As a Royal Amb, we received a room upgrade to a nice 2 room suite on the newly remodeled side of the hotel. Had a great view of the Zoo. Room was well appointed, and very modern. The shower was powerful and wonderful, however the rain head needed to be moved a bit more in the shower area. So it idid not splash outside the door. The bed was comfortable, but would have been nice to have a single bed, instead of two beds pushed together, but that tends to be a European Norm. The checkin was uneventful. And service was excellent. The Club Lounge was great, Food everytime we went up and the free WiFi was fast and reliable, except for a couple times we experience trouble. But was quickly fixed. The breakfast and late night snacks were excellent and always warm. However, a new thing at the IC Berlin, is the Club Lounge is an extra change no matter the room you stay in. So even if you have Club Room you still have to pay extra for lounge access. But the hotel was in a great location. Very close to everything we wanted to do. But was off the main path by one street, so you did not get all the noise and crazies. I would highly recommend this hotel and will stay on my next trip to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “It's now at the top of our list of favourites”
Reviews.Author: dp_visser
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently returned from a 4-night stay at the InterContinental Berlin as part of a long, get-away weekend. Although a bit apprehensive at first, we had a wonderful surprise awaiting us when we arrived. The apprehension is due to the fact that we travel extensively across the globe and stay with IHG hotels. Our latest experiences with InterContinentals, with the exception of Prague and Dubai, has left us with a sense of frustration. Service levels are not consistent and the fact that we are Royal Ambassadors with their frequent traveller programme has left much to be desired. This hotel, however, made up for it all. Upon check-in we were immediately recognised for our membership level and received the two-room upgrade, gift in room, welcome letter and the other amenities that we had missed in so many other hotels. The staff were wonderful; professional, very helpful, efficient and friendly. The 2-room suite on the 7th floor in the renovated building, with views over the Tiergarten and the Gedächtniskirche (not visible now because of extensive renovations), was lovely. Fresh, modern, very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was very nice with the tub, large sink area and the walk-in shower with the rainshower head and side shower (both with plenty of hot water and pressure). Everything worked well in the room, with our only quirk being that the thermostat in the room was very limited. Settings were either "Off" or "Cool", which meant it would not get very cold in the room during the warm weather we had during our stay. We had access to their Club Lounge, which was very nice. This is where we had our breakfast every morning and in the evening we enjoyed a light dinner from the buffet that was on offer. A large offer was to be had in the way of soup, breads, salads, snacks and other canapés. For those that wished something more, you were able to order meals from their in room dining, which was very nice as well. There was a full bar, too, which had everything imaginable and was constantly being refilled and cleaned. The entire lounge was also a great place to relax, watch TV, listen to music on the private headphones, use the iPad on offer (WiFi was free) or use the iMac & printer also on offer. Here the staff was also very friendly and helpful. The actual hotel location is fantastic. It is 5 minutes by foot from the Kufürstendamm and bus 200 stops in front of the hotel. This bus route goes to the main sights in East Berlin and to West Berlin. For those wanting to go north or south of the city, just a block or two away is where you catch bus 100. Tip: buy a day ticket for € 6.30 and use these buses and the metros to see the city; avoid the tourist buses as they are crowded and not necessarily cheap, as we discovered. For getting to/from the airport, bus X09 stops at the Tiergarten station, just 10 mins away, or take a taxi for the 10 km journey (approx. € 15). One aspect about the location that we really appreciated is that the Budapester Straße is a very calm street yet the frenzy of Berlin is a few minutes away. Shoppes such as KaDeWe are also in the general vicinity, together with some good restaurants and pubs in the Schöneberg district. All-in-all we had a wonderful time at the this hotel and cannot wait to return. It is now one that we use to judge others!

Reviews.Title: “Best breakfast ever!!”
Reviews.Author: KLHFinland
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel! Good location, bus stop outside on the street, U-bahn and Trains a few minutes walk away. Rooms were big and comfy. We stayed on the 7th floor and no surrounding noice disturbed our sleep on the excellent beds. Nice service from all the staff and last but not least, breakfast buffet was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Solotraveller888
Reviews.Content: located around 4 blocks away from famous kadewe mall and other shopping areas metro rail transit is near kadewe. take the metro transit to postdamer platz where the SONY CENTER is located

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: marie_derry
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 3 nights at this hotel on a girly weekend with my mum to celebrate my 30th birthday. The hotel is brilliant and the staff were excellent. The rooms were well appointed and had some interesting gadgets like being able to move the TV so that you could watch it in the bath. The beds were really comfortable - better than my own bed at home! The breakfast was included in our rate and this was of a high standard with everything you could think off. We did not use the hotel for any other food or drink though as we thought the prices were quite high in comparison to the bars and restaurants in Berlin. The location was quiet but had good transport links with the 200 tourist bus line stopping right outside the hotel. Berlin was an amazing city and I fully intend to go back again and would consider this hotel for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Alles Gemütlichkeit at Berlin Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: nobleoz
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel not far from Zoo station. Excellent modern rooms.........a bathroom to die for! Staff very welcoming & helpful. Sunday brunch in the LA Cafe was just wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: DrJetsetter
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, great pool area (although jacuzzi was under construction), excellent rooms and awesome breakfast!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel visit on my trip to Germany”
Reviews.Author: marc l
Reviews.Content: - Very modern rooms - FAST internet! (tested it at 70mbit/sec for any nerds like me who like to know these details) - Best shower of my trip - its separate to the bath tub which is great. Nice wide shower head. - King size bed, very comfortable - First time walking into the room you can't help but think "wow very nice!"

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel in a quiet part of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: alanreynolds
Reviews.Content: This luxury hotel is about 15 mins walk from the end of the famous and ultra-lively Kurfurstendamm but lies in the much quieter and genteel area south of the Tiergarten park. The calm and so the contrast is striking. The hotel feels new. A large spacious reception area of which there is the bar and the breakfast and cafe area at the west end. We used both, but not the upmarket restaurant on the top floor. The hotel has two towers of rooms. We were lucky on a quiet weekend in August to be upgraded to a suite on the 10th floor : 1013. It was one of the best rooms I have experienced anywhere. The two beds were comfortable to sleep on. There was iron and ironing board which we used, though we struggled to understand the capsule coffee maker (a brand I had not seen elsewhere). Bottled water came every day as did large bar of chocolate on two. The bathroom had heated floor. We liked the walk-in powerful shower though why the toilet had a glass door puzzled us. The breakfast buffet was extensive, as befits a luxury hotel. We liked particularly the banana juice, fruits, cheeses and breads but we could have expanded our waistlines with many sugary or cooked dishes. Expresso coffee was available on request. There is a 15m pool on the ground floor of the east tower. To get to it from the west tower (where we were) required a lengthy journey along a second floor balcony obscured from ground floor reception. Pool was a delight to swim in. It was open from 0600 but little used by anyone else that we saw during our stay. We had dinner in the cafe area on the Saturday night. It had a bitsy barbecue. Not good value though the food was ok. Two areas for improvement: 1. We were supposed to be offered a newspaper. We were not. When I queried on Sunday, I was told they had no English papers on Sundays! On Monday, on request. i could get only Int Herald Tribune. Reception seemed unaware of download print on demand newspaper service offered by other IHG hotels. 2. The business centre charges €1.50 per 5 mins - €18 an hour to use the internet!!! A little humble cafe next door had a public laptop and asked €1 for 30 mins so I did most work there. We paid €138 per night inc breakfast; superb value for what we got. Near the Kurfurstendamm we saw a Crowne Plaza (another IHG hotel). We went into the lobby to use the toilet. The area looked rather rundown and in need of a makeover. By contrast the Pullman (an Accor Group hotel) opposite the Intercontinental felt clean and welcoming. The area is NOT good for alternative eating places. You need to walk 15 mins or so to the Kurfurstendamm and even then only the Movenpick and Let’s Go Sylt were more than fast food outlets.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: Imedvindfranord
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for just a short night, but my impression is that this is a very good hotel. My room had a wonderful view of the city. I´m not sure of what kind of room I had, all I can say is that it was big and with a very stylish bathroom. The bed was one of the most comfy beds I have ever slept in! Breakfast was excellent and with lots of alternatives. My room was in the 7th or 8th floor and the club room was on the same floor I think. Breakfast was served there. I only spent a few hours at the hotel, but I saw enough to say that it is a very stylish hotel with lots of good qualities. A good choice for a weekend in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Just Excellent”
Reviews.Author: micnk
Reviews.Content: I don't have to say a lot. The hotel is perfect, it has everything a Berlin visitor needs. The rooms are excellent, the decoration very modern and smart. Big bed (what pillows!) into the big room, desk, even a separate space for the luggages, big bathroom with all conforts, boiler for preparing tea or coffee and much more The hotel is just ten minutes by walk form the zoo. Have a rich breakfast (in the hotel's reastaurant you will find whatever you want for breakfast) and go there. You will spend at least 4-5 hours to see everything in the zoo and the aquarium.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: FergusMum
Reviews.Content: A really lovely hotel in a first class location. Food in Chinese restaurant was excellent and room service first class.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WickedTime
Reviews.Content: Check in was friendly and fast and the room was superb. Comfortable furnishings and good facilities including an iPod dock and the option to swivel the wall to watch TV from the bath! The soundproofing was excellent and the beds extremely comfortable The only slight negative was the view (or lack of) and the vastly overpriced breakfast. I fail to see how a hotel can justify charging such ridiculous rates for breakfast. Anyway, we opted to go elsewhere and found a tea garden in a park about 20 minutes walk away which was absolutely delightful and less than an eigth of the price

Reviews.Title: “right hotel right place”
Reviews.Author: mf2006
Reviews.Content: As it is an Intercontinental hotel, a lot of words are not needed.. everything nice and proper. The breakfast excellent, very nice location near the terminal of the airport bus and with a bus station (200) right outside, It si known that the buses 100 and 200 are very convinient for tourists. But there wasn; free internet access in the rooms only in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay. Great for Business and Leisure. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Alstromeria33
Reviews.Content: Busy with the conference that we were holding at the hotel, I did not have the opportunity to experience all the hotel has to offer, especially restaurants and spa. I am stil l looking for significant suggestions for enhancements and am having a hard time ! The premises looked fully renovated - rooms and conference center. Since it was a Dorint hotel until very recently I guess it was renovated by InterContinental. The hall is impressively large with cosy areas to rest. The bar is very welcoming. There are various areas to sit and enjoy including winter gardens (smoking area - one could regret but smokers really appreciate to be welcome somewhere confortable for once). The bedroom looked brand new. There are 2 buildings. With it seems different room decorations. My room was not huge but on the 10th floor with a great view to Berlin (Tiergarten, Brandbruger Gate, etc.) . The decoration was minimal and modern. I have seen other rooms of more classic and warmer tone decoration. Bedding : very good. Just I have a problem with the narrow duvets of northern countries. Closets : I was very surprised to find absolutely no drawers in my room, only hanging space. First time ever I have to leave my folded cloths and miscellaneaous in my luggage. There ... I have my "complaint" ;-) (unless it was hidden and I did not find it ?! Bathroom: nothing was missing (bathrobe, slippers, amenities). And I appreciated the kettle (coffee and tea). Breakfast : great variety and good quality ( includes freshly cooked omelettes). I would recommend trying the hot chocolate, presented in a very 'design' manner - and I was told very good. Cuisine: I am not sure if the hotel catered for our conference buffets, I guess it did and I found them of very good quality (it does not happen so often). I was a bit disappointed though by the room service (Asparagus soup and asparagus/shrimp chinese style) which did not meet my expextations. The location is great for touring, near Tiergarten, the Zoo, etc. A hop on-hop off CityTour bus can be caught 5 minutes away. In every function (room service, reception, bar, breakfast, room service, even luggage room) I found the staff very professional , efficient and helpful. Which is probably not easy when welcoming 400+ conferencers. That would be where my first compliment goes. In conclusion: I am only sorry I could not enjoy the hotel more and try the spa. The swimming pool looks great on pictures.

Reviews.Title: “5 star”
Reviews.Author: sakis1969
Reviews.Content: a 5 star hotel as you want to be..... excellend room,very professional stuff,perfect breakfast ,quiet and has good gym. it's cloose to market but not close to center of berlin.... it's near by the zoo but you have to take the bus to go to brademburg gate ,check point charlie and domme or unter den linden rd. your stay there will be elegand and luxurious

Reviews.Title: “High standard of food. Attentive and friendly staff. Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: DisgustedofTonbridge
Reviews.Content: I was one of 400 or so delegates attending a conference at the Berlin Intercontinental. As a conference venue it was exceptional. The staff were extremely efficient and helpful - without exception and the hotel facilities were very good. Despite the numbers being catered for, all of the meals were of good quality with a broad range of choices.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotel rooms I ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: OutofRange331
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in plenty of hotels for business and I've sent in what seems to be a zillion meeting rooms, but the Dorint is a step above the rest. The sleeping rooms were one of the nicest I've ever stayed in. Ample closet and storage space, large bathroom with a shower and tub, good-sized sleeping room, and super-comfy bed. The furnishings were modern, but not overly trendy and the room was divided in a way that made it quite spacious. The conference rooms were pretty standard, but the service was impeccable. And the food - numerous colleagues commented on how good the food was for breakfast and lunch. Not just your good ol' rubber chicken, but lots of fresh, healthy choices - even ample vegetarian options! The location was decent enough as well. When I was able to get a few hours to duck out of the hotel for a walk and some shopping, the main shopping street (Tauentzienstrasse) was only a ten minute walk away, which came in handy when I realized I forgot my shoes for a dinner event! Staff was pleasant and accommodating, the bar big enough to handle impromptu meetings - all and all, it was a positive stay and perfect for our meeting requirements.

HotelInfo.Name: InterContinental Berlin
HotelInfo.Address: Budapester Strasse 2, 10787 Berlin, Germany
